title: Statement by the Press Secretary on the Presidents upcoming meeting with the Prime Minister of Japan | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




September 18, 2009

 



Statement by the Press Secretary on the Presidents upcoming meeting with the Prime Minister of Japan






THE WHITE HOUSE

		Office of the Press Secretary
		__________________________________________________________
		For Immediate Release                       September 18, 2009
		 
Statement by the Press Secretary on the President’s upcoming meeting with
		the Prime Minister of Japan

		                                                                                                
		President Obama will meet with newly-elected Japanese Prime Minister Yukio Hatoyama in New York on Wednesday, September 23.  The two leaders will be in New York to attend the United Nations General Assembly.  Japan is a close friend and a key ally of the United States and the President looks forward to his first meeting with Prime Minister Hatoyama and exploring ways in which the two countries can deepen their partnership. 

		###
